response: narrative=Stewart Hammond was discovered to be missing after failing to arrive at the adult day care he was expected at near Findcastle Street, Dundee. His friend, Mark White, mentioned MP had expressed interest in revisiting an old safe house located near 41 Dock Street. Additionally, a neighbor recalled seeing him near an abandoned building and expressed concerns about a possible boating incident he might have tried, given his past interest in such activities.

narrative=Stewart Hammond, a 74-year-old male, went missing from his home at 2 Dalgleish Road, Dundee. He was last seen heading towards a snow area in the direction of 16 Cleghorn Street, Dundee. Stewart's friend, Jean Hammond, had spoken to him earlier in the day about visiting a nursing home. Concerned when Stewart didn’t arrive, Jean contacted authorities. Stewart, who has a disability, was known to enjoy solitary walks in serene environments. The cold and slippery conditions in the area raised concerns. After several hours, he was traced by staff at 296A Strathmore Avenue, safe but slightly disoriented. His preference for snowy regions was noted as a factor in his unexpected route.

narrative=Stewart Hammond, a 75-year-old retired man with a disability, was last seen leaving the community center in the snow-covered area of Dundee. His brother reported that Stewart was expected to visit Mark White, a close friend, but never arrived. Stewart's vehicle was later found abandoned on 541 South Road. Fearing for his safety due to quick-changing weather conditions and his medical needs, a search was initiated. He was eventually found safe at 296A Strathmore Avenue, much to the relief of his family and friends.

narrative=Stewart Hammond was last seen leaving a local pharmacy at 31 Step Row, Dundee. His son reported him missing when he failed to return home later that evening. Concerns grew due to Stewart's propensity to wander into deserted areas and his known interest in local abandoned buildings. It is believed he may have headed towards Discovery Quay, which has a few old structures nearby. Search efforts also covered snow areas around 12 South Esk Road, Forfar. There was speculation about a possible boating incident as some of Stewart's belongings were later found near a derelict boat moored close to Discovery Quay. Police eventually located him there, mildly disoriented but unharmed.

narrative=Stewart Hammond, whose mobility was limited due to disability, was last seen by friends strolling near East School Road, Dundee. He missed his usual visit to the church, prompting concerns. Police found him safely in Forfar later.

narrative=Stewart Hammond was last seen at a school bus stop near his home on Dalgleish Road. His daughter, Tracey Parkinson, raised concerns after noticing he didn't return from what should have been a short walk. Police efforts were heightened given his disability and his tendency to wander into urban areas around abandoned buildings. After an extensive search, Stewart was located in a disused building on Lothian Crescent, unharmed but disoriented. His family expressed relief upon his safe return.

narrative=Stewart Hammond, a 76-year-old retiree, was last known to be seen by a friend near Kirsty Semple Way, Dundee. Earlier that morning, he had mentioned visiting the nearby river for a leisurely boat ride, sparking concerns of a possible boating incident when he failed to return. A former acquaintance, Joseph, reported seeing Hammond looking slightly disoriented near 1 Pitfour Street, Dundee. Since his disappearance, local authorities have focused their search on water areas due to his possible boating activity. Stewart was later traced by police on Auldbar Road in Forfar, safe but slightly confused, indicating he may have traveled inadvertently from the original location.

narrative=Stewart Hammond was reported missing from his home at 2 Dalgleish Road, Dundee. A family friend mentioned that Stewart was last seen heading towards the school bus stop on East School Road, Dundee. He frequently visited snow areas for leisurely walks despite his age and disability which concerned his brother, Joseph. Given his condition, the family was alarmed, prompting a swift search. While Stewart was familiar with the routes, a wrong turn could prove dangerous in the cold conditions. The search intensified when a friend recalled Stewart mentioning a safe house he once visited on Tayside Street, Carnoustie. Eventually, the police traced him to King's Cross Road, where he had taken shelter after losing his way in the snow, unharmed but confused.

narrative=Stewart Hammond, age 76, was reported missing from his home on 2 Dalgleish Road, Dundee. Known to enjoy boating activities despite his age, Stewart was last seen at 2 Alex King Way, Arbroath, close to marina facilities renowned for recreational boating. His son, concerned after several unanswered calls, retraced Stewart's usual route, leading police to suspect a possible boating incident. Days later, after a detailed search along key urban locations, Stewart was found safe at 31 Church Road, Dundee. Authorities believe he inadvertently traveled further than intended, becoming disoriented in the process.

narrative=Stewart Hammond was last seen at a school bus stop on his regular walking route, an area familiar to him in Dundee. Known for his routine, he often took morning strolls around the neighborhood. His brother, who occasionally joined him, noted nothing unusual earlier in the day. After Stewart failed to return home, his brother contacted local authorities, expressing concern, particularly due to Stewart's disability. The investigation revealed no immediate signs of foul play. A broken-down vehicle was found nearby, but it is unclear if it was related to Stewart's absence. Authorities later discovered he had temporarily sought refuge at a safe house, confused about his surroundings. Police traced him to Discovery Quay where he was finally located safe and unharmed.
narrative=Stewart Hammond was last seen by a friend near an abandoned building on his regular walking route. A possible boating incident led to his disappearance.
